description: Trap being generated when a bundle goes down.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleDownTrap BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleNameStr s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleDownCause i 1 BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleContactInfo s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleDescrInfo s EXAMPLE

description: Name of the bundle going UP/DOWN.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleNameStr

description: Reason for the bundle going down
admin_delete - bundle has been deleted by administrator
admin_down - bundle has been disabled administratively
l1-failure - Layer 1 failures (physical links),
including physical alarms, errors,etc. If a bundle
is a multilink bundle, then the bundle will go down
if all the inks go down. In case of MFR
bundles, bundles behave according to the
bandwidth class settings.
l2-failure - Layer 2 related failures: LCP for PPP and
LMI for FR bundles.
bcp-negotiation-fail - BCP negotiation failures on PPP bundles.
l3-failure - Layer 3 related failures. NCP for PPP. Incase of
FR bundles, the layer 3 negotiation failures
will not bring the bundle down.
bundle-track-down - Bundle is disabled by bundle tracking
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleDownCause

description: Name of the person who can be contacted
for information about the bundle.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleContactInfo

description: Brief description of the bundle.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleDescrInfo

description: Trap being generated when a bundle comes up.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleUpTrap BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleNameStr s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleContactInfo s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleDescrInfo s EXAMPLE

description: Name of the bundle going UP/DOWN.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleNameStr

description: Name of the person who can be contacted
for information about the bundle.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleContactInfo

description: Brief description of the bundle.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnbundleDescrInfo

description: Trap being generated when a link from a bundle goes down.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkDownTrap BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkNum s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkType i 1 BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkCt3Num s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkDownCause i 1 BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkBundleName s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkCircuitId s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkContactInfo s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkNameInfo s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkDescrInfo s EXAMPLE

description: linkNum is the number of the T1/E1 link.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkNum

description: linkType specifies the interface type
(i.e., CT3, T1, FT1, T3, E1, FE1, v35 and HSSI) of the link.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkType

description: linkCt3Num specifies the interface
number of the CT3/CE3 interface.
This variable holds significance only for
link type t1-within-ct3 and e1-within-ce3.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkCt3Num

description: Reason for the bundle going down
admin-delete - link has been removed/deleted from the
bundle by the administrator
admin-down - physical link has been disabled administratively
from module configuration commands,
e.g. 'no enable t1 1'
drop-config - link has been removed from the bundle due to
event being triggered by the error threshold
configuration for the link. e.g. 'drop es 10'
command setting from the bundle configuration
commands.
l1-failure - Layer 1 failures (physical links), including
physical alarms, excessive errors,etc.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkDownCause

description: Name of the bundle in which the link belongs to.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkBundleName

description: Configured cuircuit Id of the link
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkCircuitId

description: Configured contact string of the link
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkContactInfo

description: Name of the link
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkNameInfo

description: Brief description of link
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkDescrInfo

description: Trap being generated when a link whihin a bundle comes up.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkUpTrap BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkNum s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkType i 1 BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkCt3Num s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkBundleName s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkCircuitId s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkContactInfo s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkNameInfo s EXAMPLE BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkDescrInfo s EXAMPLE

description: linkNum is the number of the T1/E1 link.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkNum

description: linkType specifies the interface type
(i.e., CT3, T1, FT1, T3, E1, FE1, v35 and HSSI) of the link.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkType

description: linkCt3Num specifies the interface
number of the CT3/CE3 interface.
This variable holds significance only for
link type t1-within-ct3 and e1-within-ce3.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkCt3Num

description: Name of the bundle in which the link belongs to.
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkBundleName

description: Configured cuircuit Id of the link
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkCircuitId

description: Configured contact string of the link
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkContactInfo

description: Name of the link
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkNameInfo

description: Brief description of link
variables.name: BUNDLE-MIB::nnlinkDescrInfo
